s170: Chu rescued Rong, who was able to return, drove out Tian Jia, established Dan's son Shi as Qi king, beginning.
s171: Twelfth. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu campaigned west, executed the Sanchuan magistrate Li You at Yongqiu.
s178: Thirteenth. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu was afraid, returned army to Pengcheng.
s180: Second. Tian Jia fled to Chu, Chu hurried to Qi to rescue Zhao. Tian Rong refused because of Jia, saying 'Chu must kill Jia before I send troops.' Xiang Yu was angry at Tian Rong.
s181: Thirteenth. Pei Gong heard Xiang Liang was dead, returned army, followed Huai Wang, encamped at Dang.
s183: Wei Bao established himself as Wei king, capital at Pingyang, beginning.
s187: Fifth. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general.
s188: Huai Wang enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, as deputy general, subordinate to Song Yi, north to rescue Zhao.
s189: Tenth. Qin army besieged Xie at Julu, Chen Yu went out to gather troops.
s191: Fourteenth. Huai Wang enfeoffed Pei Gong as Wu'an Hou, commanding Dang commandery troops west, agreed that first to reach Xianyang would be king there.
s199: Eleventh. Zhang Han defeated Handan, moved its people to Henei.
s200: Fourth. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.
s201: Fifteenth. Attacked and broke Dong commandery wei and Wang Li's army south of Chengwu.
s202: Fifteenth. Sent general Zang Tu to rescue Zhao.
s207: Seventh. Appointed Ji as supreme general.
s208: Third. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, took his troops and crossed the river to rescue Julu.
s218: Fourth. Greatly defeated Qin army below Julu, all the lords' generals joined Xiang Yu.
s219: Thirteenth. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege lifted.
s220: Sixth. Former Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An came down from Jibei, followed Xiang Yu to rescue Zhao.
s221: Seventeenth. (Rescuing Zhao) arrived at Li, obtained Huang Xin and Wu Pu's armies. Fought with Qin army, defeated them.
